name: Andromeda, Bringing the Sexy in OP..NESS V1.0
Kate on the Town
description:
Fairly simple idea... Essentially Replicator deck without the replicator.

Wildside for draw and lots of passive and recurring credit income. Combined with Levy and run events that will be discounted by VoicePAD's.

Im not quite convinced about running The Toolbox quite yet. Doppleganger giving access to an extra run a turn while im on the wyldside would be amazing. But influence is always tight, and will one more run be worth more than 2 recurring creds?

Also, I love the fact that this deck has a total of 7 redundant cards if everything is installed pre Levy AR. That means 20 cards, of which 11 are awesome events and 2 are Test runs, in case something goes horribly wrong.

Yes, No plascrete... yes, that will kill me... but ... 6 link and an always full hand and hopefully some grifter credits to fight the traces will make it a little more taxing for the corp to try and kill me.

name: Enlightened 1.2
description: Weyland Industries This is the latest iteration of my original Weyland fast advance deck -- probably the slowest fast advance deck in existence. The strategy is very simple---I call it trench warfare---you advance a wall on centrals and wait to draw your Tricks to subsequently score agendas out of hand. I never build a remote unless I get Chimera or Oversighted Archer early, then I try rushing some agendas. The deck has trio of mortal enemies: Imp, Keyhole and Demolition Run. The remedy is obviously Jackson Howard. I guess I'll have to remove some Archived Memories and go for him. I hope I can get some feedback from such a great player you are!

name: kitvamp
Brawn and Brains
description:
A typical Katman deck with a personal touch. Has options of going for a long game full rig with big money and effective breakers. Fast, but slim. Replaced DesperadoSuckers with Toolbox. It's clunky, sure, but it is a general all purpose box, one that works nicely with a Modded, and pays dividends. Might make a version with UnderCon and other "if you have 2 or more link" cards.

Fast enough to bounce things like a typical Katman, but you can also take turns and develop your board. Hope it works out.

name: じんてき
description:
Any acceleration constitutes progress, Miss Glory. Nature had no understanding of the modern rate of work.

When I first saw Lysander's deck I thought 'Damn, I wish I came up with this myself.' But I never would, because I'm simply not able to make things simple. I don't consider this my creation at all. I think it basically the same deck, although very different at first glance.

They stopped being machines. You see, they realize their superiority and they hate us. They hate everything human. - Karel Čapek, R.U.R.

name: Blue Knight
description:
Deck strategy : run run run

winner of store championship 15/02 and 3rd place 22/02, also finished 2nd of BGG netrunner true colors league

name: Whizzard - AS.
Noise's Hemorroids Knightmare
description:
Tutor and Install Nerve Agent/Medium/Hemorroids ONLY if you need them. Use Cyberfeeder for installing viruses.

Keep the pressure with Siphon's and ice destruction.

name: Blackguard Cred Denial (Feedback)
description: This is the deck I am planning on using at a store championship in my area. Having success with it but looking to tighten it up. Faerie is primarily power shut down defense and emergency sentry break. RD interface for pressure. I am finding that after getting blackguard down I can make the corp broke for the rest of the game and control the board. I cut the data sucker anarch breaker suite because I am not running that much.

name: Coming At You With A Crowbar
Starter Deck - Runner Beginner
description:
People often ask for starter decks when they first get Netrunner to get an idea of how to deck build or what makes a deck strong. The recommended starter decks in the core set aren’t very efficient nor do they use any influence, so I have worked with some friends to design a few starter decks. Every starter deck is made of a single core set and we have also made variants with no 1-of cards so anyone with 3 core-sets can throw together these starter decks and have them lying around to introduce new players. We have tested the Beginner decks against each other and the Intermediate decks against each other and they are pretty balance with the runner winning slightly more often.

Beginner decks are designed for players just picking up the game. They are straight forward and have very little tricks.

Intermediate decks introduce players to more complex and interesting concepts such as search, traps, and viruses.

Advanced decks are your own decks that you design and build. Get familiar with the other factions and cards. Experiment and have fun!

This deck is the most basic of runner decks. Get money, play your breakers, and run. Since this is a beginner deck we didn’t want to use search as new players would have no idea what ice breakers they should even search for. Instead we put in enough breakers that you are bound to hit them pretty quickly. Diesels are good for digging if needed.

To make this deck with no 1-ofs. -1 The Toolbox +1 Tinkering

name: Starter Deck - Corp Beginner (Weyland)
description:
People often ask for starter decks when they first get Netrunner to get an idea of how to deck build or what makes a deck strong. The recommended starter decks in the core set aren’t very efficient nor do they use any influence, so I have worked with some friends to design a few starter decks. Every starter deck is made of a single core set and we have also made variants with no 1-of cards so anyone with 3 core-sets can throw together these starter decks and have them lying around to introduce new players. We have tested the Beginner decks against each other and the Intermediate decks against each other and they are pretty balance with the runner winning slightly more often.

Beginner decks are designed for players just picking up the game. They are straight forward and have very little tricks.

Intermediate decks introduce players to more complex and interesting concepts such as search, traps, and viruses.

Advanced decks are your own decks that you design and build. Get familiar with the other factions and cards. Experiment and have fun!

The goal for this deck was to make a fortress deck with very little tricks. Weyland seemed like a good choice as they have very strong burst economy and strong ICE with Hadrian’s Wall and Archer. Splashed in Tollbooth for a strong Code Gate, Rototurrets for extra trashing, and Adonis Campaign for more money. Get money, play ICE, advance agendas. Simple and effective.

This deck contains no 1-ofs.

name: Starter Deck - Runner Intermediate
description:
People often ask for starter decks when they first get Netrunner to get an idea of how to deck build or what makes a deck strong. The recommended starter decks in the core set aren’t very efficient nor do they use any influence, so I have worked with some friends to design a few starter decks. Every starter deck is made of a single core set and we have also made variants with no 1-of cards so anyone with 3 core-sets can throw together these starter decks and have them lying around to introduce new players. We have tested the Beginner decks against each other and the Intermediate decks against each other and they are pretty balance with the runner winning slightly more often.

Beginner decks are designed for players just picking up the game. They are straight forward and have very little tricks.

Intermediate decks introduce players to more complex and interesting concepts such as search, traps, and viruses.

Advanced decks are your own decks that you design and build. Get familiar with the other factions and cards. Experiment and have fun!

This deck was designed to introduce players to some of the more interesting programs such as static breakers (Yog.0 and Mimic) as well as viruses. We also introduce search with Special Order, ICE destruction with Parasite, and card synergy (Datasucker with static breakers and Parasite). Noise’s ability also makes things interesting for the Corp as they will have to learn to also protect Archives from attack.

To make this deck with no 1-ofs. -1 Grimoire -1 Ice Carver +2 Stimhack

name: Starter Deck - Corp Intermediate
description:
People often ask for starter decks when they first get Netrunner to get an idea of how to deck build or what makes a deck strong. The recommended starter decks in the core set aren’t very efficient nor do they use any influence, so I have worked with some friends to design a few starter decks. Every starter deck is made of a single core set and we have also made variants with no 1-of cards so anyone with 3 core-sets can throw together these starter decks and have them lying around to introduce new players. We have tested the Beginner decks against each other and the Intermediate decks against each other and they are pretty balance with the runner winning slightly more often.

Beginner decks are designed for players just picking up the game. They are straight forward and have very little tricks.

Intermediate decks introduce players to more complex and interesting concepts such as search, traps, and viruses.

Advanced decks are your own decks that you design and build. Get familiar with the other factions and cards. Experiment and have fun!

This deck introduces traps and damage. The Corp will also have to play smart since most of the ICE is not that expensive to break or doesn’t stop the runner. Upgrades are also introduced with Akitaro Watanabe (unless you are making the no 1-ofs version). The Corp will have to learn smart ICE placement, money management, and timing. The Runner will have to learn when it is safe to run and how to reduce risk of flatlining.

To make this deck with no 1-ofs. -1 Akitaro Watanabe +1 Enigma

name: Ice destruction
Blackmail deck
Black Parasite
description: Oblige the Corp rez ICE with Blackguard + expose card effects, then trash the ICE with Parasite. There is various recursion effect to bring Parasite back.

name: Social Engineering
description:
The core is adapted from some ideas that have been floating around, but this is my spin. The idea is the same:

Use draw cards to rip through the deck, find your NACH, Activist Support, and go to town with Bad Publicity and Blackguard. Ideally you can get through the game with them rezzing little to no ice, but don't be afraid to Test Run a breaker if you think the game is worth the candle.

Use the Source to slow down the corp if you see it before your win condition is in place.

Finding an Aesop early is excellent; it allows you to shut off Activist Support and remove the Source when you're ready to start really putting the pressure on.

name: Noisebleed
description: A good old Noise virus deck, going aggressive with AS and Hemorrhage. Mill the R&D with virus and HQ with Hemorrhage. Demolition Run after a nerve agent or medium is amazing.
